text:
Hi, <@U66GD0880> the packae server is again returning 404, this time for last 2 versions of ChainRules:
Versions 0.7.43 and 0.7.44 respectively:
`<https://pkg.julialang.org/package/082447d4-558c-5d27-93f4-14fc19e9eca2/38ad0177c30bd2fd76822445889c0a25cfbfc6f0>`
`<https://pkg.julialang.org/package/082447d4-558c-5d27-93f4-14fc19e9eca2/a335cce5957911fb345c24b27e0f0bca9c950f83>`
And the same thing happens for Plots, version 1.10.1:
`<https://pkg.julialang.org/package/91a5bcdd-55d7-5caf-9e0b-520d859cae80/4797acb266b8d9ff316f4581924e71c6709f152d>`
And also GPUArrays 6.2.0 `<https://pkg.julialang.org/package/0c68f7d7-f131-5f86-a1c3-88cf8149b2d7/f99a25fe0313121f2f9627002734c7d63b4dd3bd>`

elements.text: Hi,

the packae server is again returning 404, this time for last 2 versions of ChainRules:
Versions 0.7.43 and 0.7.44 respectively:
And the same thing happens for Plots, version 1.10.1:
And also GPUArrays 6.2.0
When were these released?

text: They don't seem to be available in the storage servers so guess we have to wait for Elliot.

elements.text: They don't seem to be available in the storage servers so guess we have to wait for Elliot.

text:
ChainRules 0.7.43 were merged to General in 6.1.2021,  3:13PM GMT+1
Plots 1.10.1: 7.1.2021,  12:51AM GMT+1
GPUArrays 6.1.2021,  1:30PM GMT+1

elements.text:
ChainRules 0.7.43 were merged to General in 6.1.2021,  3:13PM GMT+1
Plots 1.10.1: 7.1.2021,  12:51AM GMT+1
GPUArrays 6.1.2021,  1:30PM GMT+1

text:
I understand it takes some time till new versions get to the storage server.
I think it would be nice if there was option to set "download newest suitable version present in package server" instead of defaulting to github.
I understand that for most usecases it's best way to default to <http://github.com|github.com>, but e.g. behind corporate firewall, where we have only the package server whitelisted, I would rather use older version of library (if it will satisfy the compat) than having the CI fail because it can't reach <http://github.com|github.com>.

Should I fill such feature as an issue to Pkg.jl?
I think it's quite important if a company want to use Julia in a controlled environment.
